channel.title: Headicons

item.title: Headicons
item.dc:creator: @Shogunreaper Shogunreaper
item.description:
@Shogunreaper wrote:

Like this is the glitch, They are fighting, They kill someone, They put on protect melee to stop pjers, But when they take the protect melee off, The headicon stays above the head, even though it does nothing.

Switching to another prayer will not take it away. (it will switch to the other headicon, but once they take that off it goes back to protect melee)

I want it to be like, ::off (If they have a skull on it will just take away the melee protect.)

Read full topic

item.title: Headicons
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

What about… if this doesnt work, im not really sure

if (command.startsWith("off"))
    try {
        String Zero = "headi 0";
        int headi = Integer.parseInt(Zero.substring(6));
        while(headIcon != 0)
        {
            headIcon = headi;
        }
        appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
    } catch(Exception e) {
        System.out.println(e.getMessage());
        e.printStackTrace();
}

Read full topic

item.title: Headicons
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6));

and you are typing
::headi 0
so,

public class Headi {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String Zero = "headi 0";
        int headi = Integer.parseInt(Zero.substring(6));
        System.out.println(headi);
    }
}

oh look, i just get 0.

try this then

if (command.startsWith("off"))
    try {
        String Zero = "headi 0";
        int headi = Integer.parseInt(Zero.substring(6));
        headIcon = headi;
        appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
    } catch(Exception e) {
        System.out.println(e.getMessage());
        e.printStackTrace();
}
}

item.title: Headicons
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

No read it again…

e.getMessage():

Returns the detail message string of this throwable.

e.printStackTrace():

Prints this throwable and its backtrace to the standard error stream. This method prints a stack trace for this Throwable object on the error output stream that is the value of the field System.err. The first line of output contains the result of the toString() method for this object. Remaining lines represent data previously recorded by the method fillInStackTrace().

i’m trying to work out why you are getting the error.

but dont worry. i cba.

item.title: Headicons
item.dc:creator: @Shogunreaper Shogunreaper
item.description:
@Shogunreaper wrote:

Is there anyway to make this Only take headicons away like ::off and it will take all headicons away, I don’t want to do ::headi 0, because i need everyone to be able to use this command without being able to abuse it, so just ::off and it takes the headicons or sets it to 0?

if (command.startsWith("headi") && playerRights >= 1)
{
try {
int headI = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6));
headIcon = headI;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
} catch(Exception e) {
sM("Error changing head icon.");
}
}

Read full topic
